html:
390 U.S. 206

88 S.Ct. 902

19 L.Ed.2d 1039

Edward ANDERSON et al.
v.
GEORGIA.

No. 329, Misc.

Supreme Court of the United States

October Term, 1967.

March 4, 1968

Jack Greenberg, Charles Stephen Ralston and Michael Meltsner, for petitioners.

Arthur K. Bolton, Atty. Gen. of Georgia, G. Ernest Tidwell, Executive Asst. Atty. Gen., and Marion O. Gordon, Asst. Atty. Gen., for respondent.

On Petition for Writ of Certiorari to the Supreme Court of Georgia.

PER CURIAM.

1

The motion for leave to proceed in forma pauperis and the petition for a writ of certiorari are granted. The judgments of the Supreme Court of Georgia are reversed. Whitus v. State of Georgia, 385 U.S. 545, 87 S.Ct. 643, 17 L.Ed.2d 599.

2

Mr. Justice HARLAN would set the case for plenary consideration.

PER CURIAM.

The motion for leave to proceed in forma pauperis and the petition for a writ of certiorari are granted. The judgments of the Supreme Court of Georgia are reversed. Whitus v. Georgia, 385 U. S. 545.

MR. JUSTICE HARLAN would set the case for plenary consideration.
